name: The Journalist and the Murderer
author: Janet Malcolm
description: On sensationalism and the purpose of the journalism industry.

name: Industrial Megaprojects: Concepts, Strategies, and Practices for Success
author: Edward Merrow
description: What are the pitfalls of a complex project and how to avoid them.

name: The Phantom Public
author: Walter Lippmann
description: What exactly is a democracy and who should make decisions?

name: Propaganda
author: Edward L Bernays
description: How exactly does one gain influence in the court of public opinion?

name: Order Without Design: How Markets Shape Cities
author: Alain Bertaud
description: How cities emerge out and how planners can use markets and quantitative metrics to create better cities.

name: The Master Switch: The Rise and Fall of Information Empires
author: Tim Wu
description: Media consolidation and its applications to the Internet.

name: Transcend
author: Scott Barry Kaufman
description: Kaufman delves into humanistic psychology and Abraham Maslow to help figure out how humans should best live their lives.

name: Range
author: David Epstein
description: David Epstein examines how one should proceed with one's career, be it specialization or generalization. He goes into kind learning environments, unkind environments, the difference between the two, and the impact of far transfer.
value: Creative interdisciplinary work is the future.

name: Zero To One
author: Peter Thiel and Blake Masters
description: Thiel explains his outlook on life, what he looks for in a successful startup, and how you can take your startup from 0 to 1.
value: Contrarianism, Understanding tribalism, startup building. Master's online notes are better though.

name: The Mom Test
author: Rob Fitzpatrick
description: Rob explains how to gather user feedback, determine what users want, and avoid preference falsification without falling into the traditional pitfalls of self-validation.
value: How to understand people and their problems.

name: The Black Swan
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb
description: Taleb explains how we have this misguided notion of the bell curve, and how actually outlier events tend to define the narrative vis a vis fat-tailed distributions.

name: Deep Work
author: Cal Newport
description: Newport explains how society is progressing and the phenomenon of deep work. Instead of pretending to be busy or being consistently distracted and interrupted, Newport creates a schedule to optimize unconscious thought and flow.

name: Manufacturing Consent
author: Noam Chomsky and Edward Herman
description: Chomsky and Herman explore how the media is entangled with power and not necessarily in a good way. They explore how the Overton window gets set and what method and reasoning is used to prevent change to the status quo.

name: A Tree Grows In Brooklyn
author: Betty Smith
description: Smith details the world of a young girl, her childhood in Brooklyn, and her continued resilience in the face of adversity.

name: The Dream Machine: J.C.R. Licklider and the Revolution That Made Computing Personal
author: M. Mitchell Waldrop
